page.title: 16BELGRAVE OR BEL'S GRAVE ?
page.content:
This is the old legend of how{Belgrave got its name.Many years ago when giants roamed the land a boastful giant called Bel said he could get to Leicester in three mighty leaps.To prove this he mounted his sorrel mare at a place called{Mountsorrel}and took his first mighty leap.He rode by {Rothley }and landed in{Wanlip}(one leap).He then jumped a second time and landed in{Birstall},so called because his horse "burst its all" and couldn't go on.His third and final leap landed one and a half miles short of Leicester and there he was buried in a place called{Belgrave}(Bel's grave).
Of course this is only a legend.In the Domesday Book Belgrave was known as Merdegrave but the Normans soon renamed it Belgrave (beautiful grove) This translated better into French!
